intro: Satyrium lupulinum, commonly known as the common wolfberry, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, and it produces small, spherical fruits that are typically green when mature. The plant is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in open woodlands and grassy areas. It has a long history of use in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. The species is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ease of cultivation.
